subject: Re: [junit] @finally
msgSnippet: ... I thought @After already behaves like @Finally. In JUnit 3, tearDown() behaves like finally. -- J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger :: http://www.jbrains.ca Your guide
messageBody:
sauravkr wrote:

> I expect another annotation in apart from @before and @After that is
> @Finally. That should behave like finally and can be used for valuable
> work like closing file or IO in case of exception has occurred.
>
> Also, I want some annotation instead of @beforeClass which can be
> applied for non static method and called only once as Constructors are
> called in normal java.
>
> Any suggestion ??

I thought @After already behaves like @Finally. In JUnit 3, tearDown()
behaves like finally.
